alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Venango (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 9:55PM EDT until July 20 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR MERCER AND WEST CENTRAL VENANGO COUNTIES... At 955 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from thunderstorms has tapered off. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is still possible this evening due to runoff from the heavy rainfall earlier. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hermitage, Sharon, Sharpsville, Greenville, Farrell, Mercer, Stoneboro, West Middlesex, Sandy Lake, Clark, Wheatland, Jamestown, Fredonia, Jackson Center, New Lebanon, Sheakleyville and Maurice K Goddard State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
